object_id.description: The id of the object the ACL applies to

user_id.description: Id of the user the ACL applies to. Exactly one of `user_id` and `group_id` will be provided

group_id.description: Id of the group the ACL applies to. Exactly one of `user_id` and `group_id` will be provided

allOf.description: Permission the ACL grants. Exactly one of `permission` and `role_id` will be provided
When setting a permission directly, optionally restricts the permission grant to just the specified object type. Cannot be set alongside a `role_id`.

role_id.description: Id of the role the ACL grants. Exactly one of `permission` and `role_id` will be provided

_object_org_id.description: The organization the ACL's referred object belongs to

Acl.description:
An ACL grants a certain permission or role to a certain user or group on an object.

ACLs are inherited across the object hierarchy. So for example, if a user has read permissions on a project, they will also have read permissions on any experiment, dataset, etc. created within that project.

To restrict a grant to a particular sub-object, you may specify `restrict_object_type` in the ACL, as part of a direct permission grant or as part of a role.

AclObjectType.description: The object type that the ACL applies to

id.description: Unique identifier for the AI secret

updated_at.description: Date of last AI secret update

max_tokens_to_sample.description: This is a legacy parameter that should not be used.

id.description: Unique identifier for the api key

error_message.description: Describes the error encountered while uploading.

allOf.description: The preprocessor function to use for facet extraction. If not provided, the project default preprocessor will be used, falling back to the global 'thread' preprocessor.

prompt.description: The prompt to use for LLM extraction. The preprocessed text will be provided as context.

model.description: The model to use for facet extraction

embedding_model.description: The embedding model to use for vectorizing facet results.

no_match_pattern.description: Regex pattern to identify outputs that do not match the facet. If the output matches, the facet will be saved as 'no_match'

function_name.description: The name of the topic map function

topic_map_id.description: The id of the topic map function

topic_maps.description: Topic maps that depend on facets in this batch, keyed by source facet name

type.description: An identifier to help disambiguate parsing.

filename.description: Human-readable filename for user interfaces. Not related to attachment storage.

key.description: Key in the object store bucket for this attachment.

file_id.title: The ID of an uploaded file to use as input.

ChatCompletionMessageReasoning.description: Note: This is not part of the OpenAI API spec, but we added it for interoperability with multiple reasoning models.

project_id.description: Unique identifier for the project that the dataset belongs under

name.description: Name of the dataset. Within a project, dataset names are unique

deleted_at.description: Date of dataset deletion, or null if the dataset is still active

user_id.description: Identifies the user who created the dataset

url_slug.description: URL slug for the dataset. used to construct dataset URLs

id.description: A unique identifier for the dataset event. If you don't provide one, Braintrust will generate one for you

_xact_id.description: The transaction id of an event is unique to the network operation that processed the event insertion. Transaction ids are monotonically increasing over time and can be used to retrieve a versioned snapshot of the dataset (see the `version` parameter)

created.description: The timestamp the dataset event was created

_pagination_key.description: A stable, time-ordered key that can be used to paginate over dataset events. This field is auto-generated by Braintrust and only exists in Brainstore.

project_id.description: Unique identifier for the project that the dataset belongs under

input.description: The argument that uniquely define an input case (an arbitrary, JSON serializable object)

expected.description: The output of your application, including post-processing (an arbitrary, JSON serializable object)

model.description: The model used for this example

metadata.description: A dictionary with additional data about the test example, model outputs, or just about anything else that's relevant, that you can use to help find and analyze examples later. For example, you could log the `prompt`, example's `id`, or anything else that would be useful to slice/dice later. The values in `metadata` can be any JSON-serializable type, but its keys must be strings

tags.description: A list of tags to log

span_id.description: A unique identifier used to link different dataset events together as part of a full trace. See the [tracing guide](https://www.braintrust.dev/docs/instrument) for full details on tracing

root_span_id.description: A unique identifier for the trace this dataset event belongs to

is_root.description: Whether this span is a root span

comments.description: Optional list of comments attached to this event

audit_data.description: Optional list of audit entries attached to this event

facets.description: Facets for categorization (dictionary from facet id to value)

confidence.description: Optional confidence score for the classification

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the classification

function_id.description: Optional function id that produced the classification

topic_map_id.description: Optional topic map id that produced the classification

classifications.description: Classifications for this event (dictionary from classification name to items)

id.description: Unique identifier for the environment variable

object_type.description: The type of the object the environment variable is scoped for

object_id.description: The id of the object the environment variable is scoped for

name.description: The name of the environment variable

used.description: Date the environment variable was last used

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the environment variable when managed via the function secrets API

secret_type.description: Optional classification for the secret (for example, the AI provider name)

secret_category.description: The category of the secret: env_var for regular environment variables, ai_provider for AI provider API keys

id.description: Unique identifier for the eval status page

project_id.description: Unique identifier for the project that the eval status page belongs under

user_id.description: Identifies the user who created the eval status page

created.description: Date of eval status page creation

deleted_at.description: Date of eval status page deletion, or null if the eval status page is still active

name.description: Name of the eval status page

description.description: Textual description of the eval status page

logo_url.description: URL of the logo to display on the page

EvalStatusPage.description: A public eval status page that displays aggregate experiment results

score_columns.description: The score columns to display on the page

metric_columns.description: The metric columns to display on the page

grouping_field.description: The metadata field to use for grouping experiments (model)

filter.description: BTQL filter to apply to experiment data

sort_by.description: Field to sort results by (format: 'score:<name>' or 'metric:<name>')

api_key.description: The API key used for fetching experiment data

EvalStatusPageConfig.description: Configuration for what data to display

project_id.description: Unique identifier for the project that the experiment belongs under

name.description: Name of the experiment. Within a project, experiment names are unique

base_exp_id.description: Id of default base experiment to compare against when viewing this experiment

deleted_at.description: Date of experiment deletion, or null if the experiment is still active

dataset_id.description: Identifier of the linked dataset, or null if the experiment is not linked to a dataset

dataset_version.description: Version number of the linked dataset the experiment was run against. This can be used to reproduce the experiment after the dataset has been modified.

public.description: Whether or not the experiment is public. Public experiments can be viewed by anybody inside or outside the organization

user_id.description: Identifies the user who created the experiment

tags.description: A list of tags for the experiment

id.description: A unique identifier for the experiment event. If you don't provide one, Braintrust will generate one for you

_xact_id.description: The transaction id of an event is unique to the network operation that processed the event insertion. Transaction ids are monotonically increasing over time and can be used to retrieve a versioned snapshot of the experiment (see the `version` parameter)

created.description: The timestamp the experiment event was created

_pagination_key.description: A stable, time-ordered key that can be used to paginate over experiment events. This field is auto-generated by Braintrust and only exists in Brainstore.

project_id.description: Unique identifier for the project that the experiment belongs under

input.description: The arguments that uniquely define a test case (an arbitrary, JSON serializable object). Later on, Braintrust will use the `input` to know whether two test cases are the same between experiments, so they should not contain experiment-specific state. A simple rule of thumb is that if you run the same experiment twice, the `input` should be identical

output.description: The output of your application, including post-processing (an arbitrary, JSON serializable object), that allows you to determine whether the result is correct or not. For example, in an app that generates SQL queries, the `output` should be the _result_ of the SQL query generated by the model, not the query itself, because there may be multiple valid queries that answer a single question

expected.description: The ground truth value (an arbitrary, JSON serializable object) that you'd compare to `output` to determine if your `output` value is correct or not. Braintrust currently does not compare `output` to `expected` for you, since there are so many different ways to do that correctly. Instead, these values are just used to help you navigate your experiments while digging into analyses. However, we may later use these values to re-score outputs or fine-tune your models

error.description: The error that occurred, if any.

scores.description: A dictionary of numeric values (between 0 and 1) to log. The scores should give you a variety of signals that help you determine how accurate the outputs are compared to what you expect and diagnose failures. For example, a summarization app might have one score that tells you how accurate the summary is, and another that measures the word similarity between the generated and grouth truth summary. The word similarity score could help you determine whether the summarization was covering similar concepts or not. You can use these scores to help you sort, filter, and compare experiments

model.description: The model used for this example

metadata.description: A dictionary with additional data about the test example, model outputs, or just about anything else that's relevant, that you can use to help find and analyze examples later. For example, you could log the `prompt`, example's `id`, or anything else that would be useful to slice/dice later. The values in `metadata` can be any JSON-serializable type, but its keys must be strings

tags.description: A list of tags to log

start.description: A unix timestamp recording when the section of code which produced the experiment event started

end.description: A unix timestamp recording when the section of code which produced the experiment event finished

prompt_tokens.description: The number of tokens in the prompt used to generate the experiment event (only set if this is an LLM span)

completion_tokens.description: The number of tokens in the completion generated by the model (only set if this is an LLM span)

tokens.description: The total number of tokens in the input and output of the experiment event.

metrics.description: Metrics are numerical measurements tracking the execution of the code that produced the experiment event. Use "start" and "end" to track the time span over which the experiment event was produced

caller_functionname.description: The function in code which created the experiment event

caller_filename.description: Name of the file in code where the experiment event was created

caller_lineno.description: Line of code where the experiment event was created

context.description: Context is additional information about the code that produced the experiment event. It is essentially the textual counterpart to `metrics`. Use the `caller_*` attributes to track the location in code which produced the experiment event

span_id.description: A unique identifier used to link different experiment events together as part of a full trace. See the [tracing guide](https://www.braintrust.dev/docs/instrument) for full details on tracing

span_parents.description: An array of the parent `span_ids` of this experiment event. This should be empty for the root span of a trace, and should most often contain just one parent element for subspans

root_span_id.description: A unique identifier for the trace this experiment event belongs to

is_root.description: Whether this span is a root span

comments.description: Optional list of comments attached to this event

audit_data.description: Optional list of audit entries attached to this event

facets.description: Facets for categorization (dictionary from facet id to value)

confidence.description: Optional confidence score for the classification

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the classification

function_id.description: Optional function id that produced the classification

topic_map_id.description: Optional topic map id that produced the classification

classifications.description: Classifications for this event (dictionary from classification name to items)

type.description: An identifier to help disambiguate parsing.

filename.description: Human-readable filename for user interfaces. Not related to attachment storage.

url.description: Fully qualified URL to the object in the external object store.

allOf.description: The preprocessor function to use for facet extraction. If not provided, the project default preprocessor will be used, falling back to the global 'thread' preprocessor.

prompt.description: The prompt to use for LLM extraction. The preprocessed text will be provided as context.

model.description: The model to use for facet extraction

embedding_model.description: The embedding model to use for vectorizing facet results.

no_match_pattern.description: Regex pattern to identify outputs that do not match the facet. If the output matches, the facet will be saved as 'no_match'

_xact_id.description: The transaction id of an event is unique to the network operation that processed the event insertion. Transaction ids are monotonically increasing over time and can be used to retrieve a versioned snapshot of the prompt (see the `version` parameter)

project_id.description: Unique identifier for the project that the prompt belongs under

log_id.description: A literal 'p' which identifies the object as a project prompt

tags.description: A list of tags for the prompt

object_id.description: Id of the object the function is originating from

internal.description: The function exists for internal purposes and should not be displayed in the list of functions.

function_schema.description: JSON schema for the function's parameters and return type

code_hash.description: SHA256 hash of the code, computed at save time

config.description: Configuration options to pass to the global function (e.g., for preprocessor customization)

project_name.description: The name of the project containing the function

global_function.description: The name of the global function. Currently, the global namespace includes the functions in autoevals

prompt_session_id.description: The ID of the prompt session

prompt_session_function_id.description: The ID of the function in the prompt session

name.description: The name of the inline code function
The name of the inline function
The name of the inline prompt

FunctionTypeEnum.description: The type of global function. Defaults to 'scorer'.

GraphData.description: This feature is preliminary and unsupported.

node.description: The id of the node in the graph
The id of the node in the graph

x.description: The x position of the node

y.description: The y position of the node

y.description: The y position of the node

y.description: The y position of the node

y.description: The y position of the node

value.description: A literal value to be returned

x.description: The x position of the node

y.description: The y position of the node

expr.description: A BTQL expression to be evaluated

x.description: The x position of the node

y.description: The y position of the node

condition.description: A BTQL expression to be evaluated

y.description: The y position of the node

y.description: The y position of the node

org_id.description:
Unique id for the organization that the group belongs under

It is forbidden to change the org after creating a group

user_id.description: Identifies the user who created the group

deleted_at.description: Date of group deletion, or null if the group is still active

member_users.description: Ids of users which belong to this group

member_groups.description:
Ids of the groups this group inherits from

An inheriting group has all the users contained in its member groups, as well as all of their inherited users

Group.description:
A group is a collection of users which can be assigned an ACL

Groups can consist of individual users, as well as a set of groups they inherit from

group_by.description: Field path to group by, e.g. metadata.session_id

idle_seconds.description: Optional: trigger after this many seconds of inactivity

GroupScope.description: Process spans/traces grouped by a field (e.g., session_id)

input.description: Argument to the function, which can be any JSON serializable value

expected.description: The expected output of the function

metadata.description: Any relevant metadata. This will be logged and available as the `metadata` argument.

tags.description: Any relevant tags to log on the span.

messages.description: If the function is an LLM, additional messages to pass along to it

stream.description: Whether to stream the response. If true, results will be returned in the Braintrust SSE format.

strict.description: If true, throw an error if one of the variables in the prompt is not present in the input

mcp_auth.description: Map of MCP server URL to auth credentials

overrides.description: Partial function definition to merge with the function being invoked. Fields are validated against the function type's schema at runtime. For facets: { preprocessor?, prompt?, model? }. For prompts: { model?, ... }.

object_id.description: The id of the container object you are logging to

row_ids.description: Identifiers for the row to to log a subspan under

propagated_event.description: Include these properties in every span created under this parent

anyOf.description: The parent's span identifier, created by calling `.export()` on a span

InvokeParent.description: Options for tracing the function call

id.description: Unique identifier for the MCP server

project_id.description: Unique identifier for the project that the MCP server belongs under

user_id.description: Identifies the user who created the MCP server

deleted_at.description: Date of MCP server deletion, or null if the MCP server is still active

name.description: Name of the MCP server. Within a project, MCP server names are unique

description.description: Textual description of the MCP server

url.description: URL of the MCP server endpoint

max_tokens_to_sample.description: This is a legacy parameter that should not be used.

NullableSavedFunctionId.description: Default preprocessor for this project. When set, functions that use preprocessors will use this instead of their built-in default.

object_type.description: Type of the object the event is originating from.

object_id.description: ID of the object the event is originating from.

_xact_id.description: Transaction ID of the original event.

created.description: Created timestamp of the original event. Used to help sort in the UI

ObjectReference.description: Reference to the original object and event this was copied from.

object_type.description: Type of the object the event is originating from.

object_id.description: ID of the object the event is originating from.

_xact_id.description: Transaction ID of the original event.

created.description: Created timestamp of the original event. Used to help sort in the UI

ObjectReferenceNullish.description: Indicates the event was copied from another object.

sampling_rate.description: The sampling rate for online scoring

scorers.description: The list of functions to run for online scoring. Can include scorers, facets, or other function types.

apply_to_root_span.description: Whether to trigger online scoring on the root span of each trace. Only applies when scope is 'span' or unset.

apply_to_span_names.description: Trigger online scoring on any spans with a name in this list. Only applies when scope is 'span' or unset.

skip_logging.description: Whether to skip adding scorer spans when computing scores

scope.description: The scope at which to run the functions. Defaults to span-level execution. Trace/group scope requires all functions to be facets.

Permission.description:
Each permission permits a certain type of operation on an object in the system

Permissions can be assigned to to objects on an individual basis, or grouped into roles

org_id.description: Unique id for the organization that the project belongs under

deleted_at.description: Date of project deletion, or null if the project is still active

user_id.description: Identifies the user who created the project

id.description: Unique identifier for the project automation

project_id.description: Unique identifier for the project that the project automation belongs under

user_id.description: Identifies the user who created the project automation

description.description: Textual description of the project automation

btql_filter.description: BTQL filter to identify rows for the automation rule

interval_seconds.description: Perform the triggered action at most once in this interval of seconds

type.description: The type of action to take

url.description: The webhook URL to send the request to

type.description: The type of action to take

workspace_id.description: The Slack workspace ID to post to

channel.description: The Slack channel ID to post to

message_template.description: Custom message template for the alert

action.description: The action to take when the automation rule is triggered

export_definition.description: The definition of what to export

export_path.description: The path to export the results to. It should include the storage protocol and prefix, e.g. s3://bucket-name/path/to/export

format.description: The format to export the results in

interval_seconds.description: Perform the triggered action at most once in this interval of seconds

role_arn.description: The ARN of the IAM role to use

external_id.description: The automation-specific external id component (auto-generated by default)

batch_size.description: The number of rows to export in each batch

retention_days.description: The number of days to retain the object

environment_filter.description: Optional list of environment slugs to filter by

url.description: The webhook URL to send the request to

workspace_id.description: The Slack workspace ID to post to

channel.description: The Slack channel ID to post to

id.description: A unique identifier for the project logs event. If you don't provide one, Braintrust will generate one for you

_xact_id.description: The transaction id of an event is unique to the network operation that processed the event insertion. Transaction ids are monotonically increasing over time and can be used to retrieve a versioned snapshot of the project logs (see the `version` parameter)

_pagination_key.description: A stable, time-ordered key that can be used to paginate over project logs events. This field is auto-generated by Braintrust and only exists in Brainstore.

created.description: The timestamp the project logs event was created

org_id.description: Unique id for the organization that the project belongs under

log_id.description: A literal 'g' which identifies the log as a project log

input.description: The arguments that uniquely define a user input (an arbitrary, JSON serializable object).

output.description: The output of your application, including post-processing (an arbitrary, JSON serializable object), that allows you to determine whether the result is correct or not. For example, in an app that generates SQL queries, the `output` should be the _result_ of the SQL query generated by the model, not the query itself, because there may be multiple valid queries that answer a single question.

expected.description: The ground truth value (an arbitrary, JSON serializable object) that you'd compare to `output` to determine if your `output` value is correct or not. Braintrust currently does not compare `output` to `expected` for you, since there are so many different ways to do that correctly. Instead, these values are just used to help you navigate while digging into analyses. However, we may later use these values to re-score outputs or fine-tune your models.

error.description: The error that occurred, if any.

scores.description: A dictionary of numeric values (between 0 and 1) to log. The scores should give you a variety of signals that help you determine how accurate the outputs are compared to what you expect and diagnose failures. For example, a summarization app might have one score that tells you how accurate the summary is, and another that measures the word similarity between the generated and grouth truth summary. The word similarity score could help you determine whether the summarization was covering similar concepts or not. You can use these scores to help you sort, filter, and compare logs.

model.description: The model used for this example

metadata.description: A dictionary with additional data about the test example, model outputs, or just about anything else that's relevant, that you can use to help find and analyze examples later. For example, you could log the `prompt`, example's `id`, or anything else that would be useful to slice/dice later. The values in `metadata` can be any JSON-serializable type, but its keys must be strings

tags.description: A list of tags to log

start.description: A unix timestamp recording when the section of code which produced the project logs event started

end.description: A unix timestamp recording when the section of code which produced the project logs event finished

prompt_tokens.description: The number of tokens in the prompt used to generate the project logs event (only set if this is an LLM span)

completion_tokens.description: The number of tokens in the completion generated by the model (only set if this is an LLM span)

tokens.description: The total number of tokens in the input and output of the project logs event.

metrics.description: Metrics are numerical measurements tracking the execution of the code that produced the project logs event. Use "start" and "end" to track the time span over which the project logs event was produced

caller_functionname.description: The function in code which created the project logs event

caller_filename.description: Name of the file in code where the project logs event was created

caller_lineno.description: Line of code where the project logs event was created

context.description: Context is additional information about the code that produced the project logs event. It is essentially the textual counterpart to `metrics`. Use the `caller_*` attributes to track the location in code which produced the project logs event

span_id.description: A unique identifier used to link different project logs events together as part of a full trace. See the [tracing guide](https://www.braintrust.dev/docs/instrument) for full details on tracing

span_parents.description: An array of the parent `span_ids` of this project logs event. This should be empty for the root span of a trace, and should most often contain just one parent element for subspans

root_span_id.description: A unique identifier for the trace this project logs event belongs to

is_root.description: Whether this span is a root span

comments.description: Optional list of comments attached to this event

audit_data.description: Optional list of audit entries attached to this event

_async_scoring_state.description: The async scoring state for this event

facets.description: Facets for categorization (dictionary from facet id to value)

confidence.description: Optional confidence score for the classification

metadata.description: Optional metadata associated with the classification

function_id.description: Optional function id that produced the classification

topic_map_id.description: Optional topic map id that produced the classification

classifications.description: Classifications for this event (dictionary from classification name to items)

id.description: Unique identifier for the project score

project_id.description: Unique identifier for the project that the project score belongs under

description.description: Textual description of the project score

position.description: An optional LexoRank-based string that sets the sort position for the score in the UI

ProjectScore.description: A project score is a user-configured score, which can be manually-labeled through the UI

anyOf.description: For categorical-type project scores, the list of all categories
anyOf.title: categorical

anyOf.description: For weighted-type project scores, the weights of each score
anyOf.title: weighted

anyOf.description: For minimum-type project scores, the list of included scores
anyOf.title: minimum

value.description: Numerical value of the category. Must be between 0 and 1, inclusive

ProjectScoreCategory.description: For categorical-type project scores, defines a single category

ProjectScoreType.description: The type of the configured score

comparison_key.description: The key used to join two experiments (defaults to `input`)

baseline_experiment_id.description: The id of the experiment to use as the default baseline for comparisons

spanFieldOrder.description: The order of the fields to display in the trace view

remote_eval_sources.description: The remote eval sources to use for the project

disable_realtime_queries.description: If true, disable real-time queries for this project. This can improve query performance for high-volume logs.

id.description: Unique identifier for the project tag

project_id.description: Unique identifier for the project that the project tag belongs under

description.description: Textual description of the project tag

color.description: Color of the tag for the UI

position.description: An optional LexoRank-based string that sets the sort position for the tag in the UI

ProjectTag.description: A project tag is a user-configured tag for tracking and filtering your experiments, logs, and other data

_xact_id.description: The transaction id of an event is unique to the network operation that processed the event insertion. Transaction ids are monotonically increasing over time and can be used to retrieve a versioned snapshot of the prompt (see the `version` parameter)

choice_scores.description: Map of choices to scores (0-1). Used by scorers.

choice.description: List of valid choices without score mapping. Used by classifiers that deposit output to tags.

allow_no_match.description: If true, adds a 'No match' option. When selected, no tag is deposited.

id.description: A unique identifier for the prompt session event. If you don't provide one, Braintrust will generate one for you

_xact_id.description: The transaction id of an event is unique to the network operation that processed the event insertion. Transaction ids are monotonically increasing over time and can be used to retrieve a versioned snapshot of the prompt session (see the `version` parameter)

created.description: The timestamp the prompt session event was created

_pagination_key.description: A stable, time-ordered key that can be used to paginate over prompt session events. This field is auto-generated by Braintrust and only exists in Brainstore.

tags.description: A list of tags to log

branch.description: Name of the branch the most recent commit belongs to

tag.description: Name of the tag on the most recent commit

dirty.description: Whether or not the repo had uncommitted changes when snapshotted

author_name.description: Name of the author of the most recent commit

author_email.description: Email of the author of the most recent commit

commit_time.description: Time of the most recent commit

git_diff.description: If the repo was dirty when run, this includes the diff between the current state of the repo and the most recent commit.

RepoInfo.description: Metadata about the state of the repo when the experiment was created

RetentionObjectType.description: The object type that the retention policy applies to

org_id.description:
Unique id for the organization that the role belongs under

A null org_id indicates a system role, which may be assigned to anybody and inherited by any other role, but cannot be edited.

It is forbidden to change the org after creating a role

user_id.description: Identifies the user who created the role

deleted_at.description: Date of role deletion, or null if the role is still active

member_permissions.description: (permission, restrict_object_type) tuples which belong to this role

member_roles.description:
Ids of the roles this role inherits from

An inheriting role has all the permissions contained in its member roles, as well as all of their inherited permissions

Role.description:
A role is a collection of permissions which can be granted as part of an ACL

Roles can consist of individual permissions, as well as a set of roles they inherit from

project_id.description: Unique identifier for the project to run the eval in

scores.description: The functions to score the eval on

experiment_name.description: An optional name for the experiment created by this eval. If it conflicts with an existing experiment, it will be suffixed with a unique identifier.

metadata.description: Optional experiment-level metadata to store about the evaluation. You can later use this to slice & dice across experiments.

stream.description: Whether to stream the results of the eval. If true, the request will return two events: one to indicate the experiment has started, and another upon completion. If false, the request will return the evaluation's summary upon completion.

trial_count.description: The number of times to run the evaluator per input. This is useful for evaluating applications that have non-deterministic behavior and gives you both a stronger aggregate measure and a sense of the variance in the results.

is_public.description: Whether the experiment should be public. Defaults to false.

timeout.description: The maximum duration, in milliseconds, to run the evaluation. Defaults to undefined, in which case there is no timeout.

max_concurrency.description: The maximum number of tasks/scorers that will be run concurrently. Defaults to 10. If null is provided, no max concurrency will be used.

base_experiment_name.description: An optional experiment name to use as a base. If specified, the new experiment will be summarized and compared to this experiment.

base_experiment_id.description: An optional experiment id to use as a base. If specified, the new experiment will be summarized and compared to this experiment.

allOf.description: Optional settings for collecting git metadata. By default, will collect all git metadata fields allowed in org-level settings.
Optionally explicitly specify the git metadata for this experiment. This takes precedence over `gitMetadataSettings` if specified.

strict.description: If true, throw an error if one of the variables in the prompt is not present in the input

stop_token.description: The token to stop the run

extra_messages.description: A template path of extra messages to append to the conversion. These messages will be appended to the end of the conversation, after the last message.

tags.description: Optional tags that will be added to the experiment.

id.description: Unique identifier for the service token

service_account_id.description: Unique identifier for the service token

name.description: Name of the span, for display purposes only

SpanAttributes.description: Human-identifying attributes of the span, such as name, type, etc.

id.description: Unique identifier for the span iframe

project_id.description: Unique identifier for the project that the span iframe belongs under

user_id.description: Identifies the user who created the span iframe

deleted_at.description: Date of span iframe deletion, or null if the span iframe is still active

description.description: Textual description of the span iframe

url.description: URL to embed the project viewer in an iframe

post_message.description: Whether to post messages to the iframe containing the span's data. This is useful when you want to render more data than fits in the URL.

SpanType.description: Type of the span, for display purposes only

id.description: The id of the span this event is for

StreamingMode.description: The mode format of the returned value (defaults to 'auto')

source_facet.description: The facet field name to use as input for classification

embedding_model.description: The embedding model to use for embedding facet values

bundle_uri.description: S3 URI of the topic map bundle (centroids, names, MLP model)

distance_threshold.description: Maximum distance to nearest centroid. If exceeded, returns no_match.

TopicMapReport.description: Saved clustering report for UI rehydration

idle_seconds.description: Consider trace complete after this many seconds of inactivity (default: 30)

TraceScope.description: Process entire traces (all spans sharing the same root_span_id)

triggered_xact_id.description: The xact_id when this function was triggered

completed_xact_id.description: The xact_id when this function completed (matches triggered_xact_id if done)

attempts.description: Number of execution attempts (for retry tracking)

scope.description: The scope of data this function operates on

avatar_url.description: URL of the user's Avatar image

object_id.description: The id of the object the view applies to

view_type.description: Type of object that the view corresponds to.

user_id.description: Identifies the user who created the view

deleted_at.description: Date of role deletion, or null if the role is still active

ViewOptions.description: Options for the view in the app

info.title: Braintrust exported typespecs
info.description: Publicly exported typespecs for the Braintrust API.
